Sentencas: A solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) stack module is presented that is designed for operation on diesel reformate in an auxiliary power unit (APU).
Titulo: Engineering aspects and hardware verification of a volume producable solid oxide fuel cell stack design for diesel auxiliary power units

Sentencas: The stack was designed using a top-down approach, based on a specification of an APU system that is installed on board of vehicles.
Titulo: Engineering aspects and hardware verification of a volume producable solid oxide fuel cell stack design for diesel auxiliary power units

Sentencas: The stack design is planar, modular and scalable with stamped sheet metal interconnectors.
Titulo: Engineering aspects and hardware verification of a volume producable solid oxide fuel cell stack design for diesel auxiliary power units

Sentencas: It features thin membrane electrode assemblies (MEAs), such as electrolyte supported cells (ESC) and operates at elevated temperatures around 800 degrees C.
Titulo: Engineering aspects and hardware verification of a volume producable solid oxide fuel cell stack design for diesel auxiliary power units

Sentencas: The stack has a low pressure drop in both the anode and the cathode to facilitate a simple system layout.
Titulo: Engineering aspects and hardware verification of a volume producable solid oxide fuel cell stack design for diesel auxiliary power units

Sentencas: An overview of the technical targets met so far is given.
Titulo: Engineering aspects and hardware verification of a volume producable solid oxide fuel cell stack design for diesel auxiliary power units

Sentencas: A stack power density of 0.2 kW l(-1) has been demonstrated in a fully integrated, thermally self-sustaining APU prototype running with diesel and without an external water supply.
Titulo: Engineering aspects and hardware verification of a volume producable solid oxide fuel cell stack design for diesel auxiliary power units
Engineering aspects and hardware verification of a volume producable solid oxide fuel cell stack design for diesel auxiliary power units
Engineering aspects and hardware verification of a volume producable solid oxide fuel cell stack design for diesel auxiliary power units
